hypso.georeference.georef.gen_resample_grid(grid_res_x, grid_res_y, bbox_coord_limits)
bbox_coord_limits is expected to be a list or tuple with 4 elements as follows:

[xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

hypso.georeference.georef.gen_resample_grid_bbox_min(grid_res_x, grid_res_y, bbox_minimal)

@bbox_minimal shall have has shape [4,2] and consists of four points describing the corner of the minimal bounding box. The width of the box is taken as the distance between point [0,:] and [3,:]. The height of the box is taken as the distance between point [2,:] and [3,:]. The x direction is taken as the direction going from point [3,:] to point [0,:]. The y direction is taken as the direction going from point [3,:] to point [2,:].

hypso.georeference.georef.get_julian_day_number(date_time)
hypso.georeference.georef.get_greenwich_mean_sidereal_time_seconds(date_time)

returns seconds since last midnight of a sidereal day

hypso.georeference.georef.minimum_bounding_rectangle(points)

Find the smallest bounding rectangle for a set of points. Returns a set of points representing the corners of the bounding box.

Parameters:

points – an nx2 matrix of coordinates

Rval:

a 4x2 matrix of bounding box corner coordinates

hypso.georeference.georef.mat_from_quat(quat)

quat must be a four element list of numbers or 4 element nump array returns a 3x3 numpy array containing the rotation matrix

hypso.georeference.georef.rotate_axis_angle(vec, axis, angle)

Rotates vector vec around axis axis by angle angle Both vec, axis, and vec_rot are column vectors. axis is a unit vector, angle is in radians

hypso.georeference.georef.R_eq = 6378137.0
hypso.georeference.georef.f

hypso.georeference.georef.R_pl = 6356752.0
hypso.georeference.georef.ecef_to_lat_lon_alt(pos)

input pos has to be Nx3, and units in meters returns lat lon (with respect to ECI axes) and altitude in degrees and meters

hypso.georeference.georef.eci_to_lat_loneci_alt(pos)
hypso.georeference.georef.eci_lon_to_ecef_lon(datetime_utc, lon, time_offset)
hypso.georeference.georef.eci_to_lat_lon_alt(pos, times, time_offset)

pos needs to be Nx3 times needs to be N time_offset is a float

time_offset is an additional time offset to adjust georeferencing

hypso.georeference.georef.pos_ecef_to_lat_lon_alt(pos)
hypso.georeference.georef.lat_lon_alt_to_ecef(lla)

hypso.georeference.georef.pixel_to_latlon(px_x, px_y, tl_x, tl_y, zoom_level)

px_x, px_y: Pixel coordinates of google maps image (can be float) tl_x, tl_y: tile indices of top left (noth-western) corner (must be int) zoom_level: zoom level of the image (also must be int)

returns: lat,lon

class hypso.georeference.georef.GoogleMapsLayers
ROADMAP = 'v'
TERRAIN = 'p'
ALTERED_ROADMAP = 'r'
SATELLITE = 's'
TERRAIN_ONLY = 't'
HYBRID = 'y'
class hypso.georeference.georef.GoogleMapDownloader(lat, lng, zoom=12, layer=GoogleMapsLayers.SATELLITE)

A class which generates high resolution google maps images given a longitude, latitude and zoom level

latlon_to_tileXY()

Generates an X,Y tile coordinate based on the latitude, longitude and zoom level Returns: An X,Y tile coordinate

generateImage(**kwargs)

Generates an image by stitching a number of google map tiles together. Args:

center_tile_x: The center tile x coordinate center_tile_y: The center tile y coordinate tile_count_x: The number of tiles wide the image should be tile_count_y: The number of tiles high the image should be

Returns:

A high-resolution Goole Map image, and the tile coordinates of the top left tile in the image.

hypso.georeference.georef.main()
